title: Quiz 2: Medical Demography FQE (Jan 2023 - Review)
description: Review quiz based on available questions from the January 2023 FQE.

questions.question: Which of the following shows the correct characteristics of formal demography?
questions.explanation: Formal demography primarily deals with the quantitative aspects of population: its size, distribution across space, structure (age/sex), and changes over time.
questions.hint: Recall the four pillars: Size, Dist., Structure, Change.

questions.question: The difference between the number of births and deaths gives:
questions.explanation: Natural increase is calculated as Births minus Deaths.
questions.hint: It's the growth that happens 'naturally' without moving.

questions.question: The classic description of the demographic transition theory was set out by:
questions.explanation: Frank Notestein (1945) and C.P. Blacker (1947) are key figures in formalizing the stages of demographic transition.

questions.question: The Whipple's index is a measure of preference for ages ending in?
questions.explanation: Whipple's Index measures 'age heaping' or digit preference, where people tend to round their ages to the nearest 0 or 5.
questions.hint: Think of the most common 'round' numbers.

questions.question: Match the demographic term to its correct definition:

pairs.right: Composition in terms of age and sex groups
Total number of individuals in a defined territory
Increase/decrease due to fertility, mortality, migration

questions.explanation: Structure=Composition; Size=Number; Nuptiality=Marriage; Change=Dynamics; Distribution=Spatial arrangement.
questions.hint: Match 'Space' to Distribution and 'Marriage' to Nuptiality.

questions.question: Match the life table abbreviation to its meaning:

pairs.right: Number of deaths between age x and x+1
Probability of surviving from age x to x+1
Probability of dying between age x and x+n

questions.explanation: dx=deaths; px=survival prob; nmx=death rate; nqx=death prob; nPx=Person-years.
questions.hint: p is usually survival, q is dying.

questions.question: Match the term with its correct meaning:

pairs.right: Death of an infant aged under one year
Number of infant deaths per 1000 live births
Number of persons married per 1000 mid-year pop

questions.question: Which of the following are important reasons for learning demography? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Demography helps in planning, policy, epidemiology, economics, and understanding social trends. It is not used for performing surgeries.
questions.hint: Focus on 'Planning' and 'Population' aspects, not clinical skills.
